Reviews.Title: “Park Royal ~ A Lovely Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Duncan Y
Reviews.Content: We initially booked in 'Blind' by Virgin holidays, arrived not fully aware of what to expect but what a welcome suprise. We were on the tenth floor looking out on the Harbour, such a beautiful view on what was my first trip to Australia from the UK. We were in Australia for three weeks and spent the first three nights here, we enjoyed it so much we re-booked to stay the last two nights of our holiday. Both rooms we stayed in (on the same floor) were clean and well presented, bear in mind you pay for the location and view but we loved the room. It was cleaned daily and had everything you would need, expensive but well worth the money. I would recommend this Hotel, professional staff and great attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy, dirty and smelly”
Reviews.Author: chris n
Reviews.Content: Only one person on the desk to check people in. When a second person arrived to help he didn't seem very happy and with a scruffy appearance looked like he'd just woken up and walked straight into work. Room is very tired, the carpet is so dirty I have put my shoes back on again and the room smells of sick. I'll be checking out early and looking for somewhere else to stay. Not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A change from the ususal 'chains'”
Reviews.Author: russell t
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in April on holiday. Check in was efficient, though there was a little too much time on attempting to upsell better rooms etc. Its worth joining the loyalty programme though, even if only to get free wifi. Rooms are an adequate with a longish internal corridor which was a waste of space. There was also a lack of storage space in the room, however, there is a decent sized fridge. The bed was comfy and large and the room could be made really dark. As the location is inbetween a number of roads, traffic noise can be pretty intrusive. The location is great, with easy access to Town Hall stations and buses as well as Darling Harbour (and the ferry to Circular Quay). There is a small business centre where you can access computers and a printer. Room cleaning was variable, depending on who did it. Concierge staff efficient and friendly. All in all, we enjoyed our stay here and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: FDRH
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights for conference - not a very pleasant stay - hotel rather jaded and needs a good refurb, poor breakfast, located in the middle of elevated rodways, but very friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Regularly use for business travel”
Reviews.Author: RJCPerth
Reviews.Content: I regularly stat at the Parkroyal in Sydney when travelling on business. I can't vouch for the restaurants and bars as i'm usually in and out quickly over a couple of days but I can say that the service is really very good, check in is efficient and the staff are friendly, in fact the service levels there have continually improved on each stay over the past 12 months or so. I usually like to take a room facing the Harbour on one of the higher floors, but that's just a personal preference. The rooms have always ben well equiped, clean and tidy,with newspaper delivery every morning. The beds are comfy and they have fresh clean robes in the room and very clean bathrooms with all the trimmings you would expect. Room service is varied, and efficient & the breakfast room igreat and offers every imaginable delectible to start your day! If you're staying for pleasure, it's a short distance to Lime Warf, and just down the road from the CBD, Paddys Markets and from the Sydney Entertainment Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Lila_Perth
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! My partner and I stayed here in Dec 11 for 5 nights and the location was perfect! not even a two minute walk right into the centre of darling harbour! The staff were lovely and upgraded us to a harbour view room! The room was very clean, the bed was super comfy and we would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: megsychitto
Reviews.Content: The Parkroyal is a great location to Darling Harbour and surrounds. The place is a little tired but the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with a very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Blsquirrel
Reviews.Content: My first Australian incounter with the reverse society, that which is the British Commonwealth, came at the front door of the ParkRoyal Darling Harbour hotel in Sydney. Approaching the revolving door with my luggage after a 24 hour journey, including three flights originating in DC, I noticed the motion activated revolving door of the hotel. Entering the revolving door on the right side seemed normal until the doors started to revolve and the right side glass panel started moving towards me, I was forced into an instantaneous retreat mode as I backpeddled, trying not to trip over my bags. Welcome to Australia. From that moment on things went up hill. The desk had my room ready early and the concierge desk had the answers to my questions. The location was just around the corner from Darling Harbour's shops, bars & restaurants and attractions. As I learned and experienced more about Sydney, I became convinced this was an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but the staff made it a hassle.”
Reviews.Author: rbbrooks
Reviews.Content: I booked a twin room here on a busy weekend in March. Booked through another companies website. Hotel initially tried to make me pay for a room upgrade to get a twin room. Was rectified on check out after I mad a fuss but made the whole stay a hassle. Otherwise the hotel facilities and service was good for a reasonably priced Sydney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Allymal
Reviews.Content: Check in and checkout was really easy and the staff really friendly and helpful. They upgraded us to a Darling Harbour view room - views broken by Imax and other buildings but still a beautiful view. Breakfast was part of stay and was the same as all other buffet breakfasts. Room was clean and adequately furnished as we were only there one night. The hotel is a nice easy walk from Town hall station and access to Darling Harbour was across the road and onto a foot bridge - we were there in a few minutes at the most. Despite being surrounded by busy roads and us living in the quietest area you could imagine the traffic noise etc was not an issue. We can honestly say we will stay again and so far this has been our best stay in Sydney prior to a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: McLeod05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Park Royal for 4 nights. I can not fault anything that this hotel has to offer. Stunning view from our 10th floor Darling Harbour Outlook Room (King) windows are the cleanest I have ever seen. Very quiet position and conveniently located, central to Darling Harbour and the City Center. Breakfast is fantastic if you include it in your stay and finishes at 10.00am. 2 for 1 drinks at Connections Bar & Lounge from 5.00pm - 7.00pm Mon-Fri. Valet parking is good too. Overall this hotel is very clean and quiet too. I highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Time warp”
Reviews.Author: ausbirdlover
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quietly classy in a dated kind of way. The beige tones are reminiscent of earlier years. However, everything works and is comfortable and the location is wonderful. The rooms are quiet and supplies of everything generous. A classic good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Katherine P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good, not good value for money, I stayed in the business suite with the included breakfast and access to business club, that was the only thing I liked, it is out of the city but I liked the location as I was there for work at the Convention Centre, not central to the main city area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent...”
Reviews.Author: mohit511
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here... Nice spacious rooms and showers, but the property felt dated and could do with a makeover.... Good staff and excellent breakfast, and a decent VFM option in the heart of darling harbour....

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - Would not stay anywhere else in Sydney ever again”
Reviews.Author: Tassiejac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paryroyal Darling Harbour for 3 nights in late February. From the moment we checked in we were impressed - the receptionist upon hearing it was my husband's 40th gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. We were then able to check in early. The room was huge - even with the cot that was set up for our one year old. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel and the location was brilliant - just a short walk to the middle of the cbd, short walk to darling harbour and really close to a train line. We ate in the restaurant next door and got coffee from there every day and the service was always amazine. We have stayed in Darling Harbour before but normally on the other side of the harbour. This was much better as we were a hop, skip and a jump to everything. We actually stayed here as part of a mystery deal with lastminute.com and the room was brilliant for the price - we have decided that we will not stay anywhere else in Sydney from now on. Everyone went out of their way to be lovely and helpful to us - down to providing complimentary umbrellas during a downpour. Loved it. Cannot speak highly enough of this place.

Reviews.Title: “great location helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rose2312
Reviews.Content: loved the helpful staff downstairs loved the convenience of where the parkroyal was. close to the harbour and 2 blocks from the city.would have loved it to have a pool but that was the only drawback. and enough to do without one really.hotel had happy hour good takeaway coffee available would recommend it to anyone wanting to be close to darling harbour

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Yummy Breakfast! A++”
Reviews.Author: RachaelKate
Reviews.Content: I took my son to Sydney to see the Harry Potter Exhibition for his birthday and we stayed here because the price was right and the location was excellent. Our package included breakfast and a late checkout of 3pm ($186). The reception staff were lovely! Not only did they let us check in several hours before their allowed check in time but they also upgraded our room to a suite. We had great views of Darling Harbour and also of Sydney City & the Sydney Eye. The hotel was in a great location, walking distance to public transport (5 minute stroll to Town Hall Station), and an easy walk to Darling Harbour where you could easily catch a ferry or a water taxi over to Circular Quay. The room was large and spacious with a seperate lounge area. The furnishings were comfortable and well maintained. Yes the tv cabinet and the coffee table were a little 'dated' but that sort of thing doesn't bother us at all. The breakfast was delicious and abundant. Its very pricey if you don't get it included ($35 a head) so have a look around for a deal that throws it in on top of your accommodation as those deals seemed to be quite easy to find. The beds were extremely comfortable, the pillows were amazing!... and the doona was nice and warm but not to heavy. All over I would recommend this hotel to anyone. If your with little kiddies the walkover to Darling Harbour is just over the road from the hotel and it leads directly to the massive free playground which has both wet and dry activities for kids of all ages! Its close to an array of great restaurants but its also close to McDonalds and a short 15 minute stroll from the food court over in the Darling Harbour shopping centre if you want something a bit more low key :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & Great staff”
Reviews.Author: DWessels72
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Australia was amazing! We picked ParkRoyal because it was a reasonable price. What we found when we got there was not only was it a good price but an excellent location. Close walking distance to Darling Harbour where there is so much to see and do and it is just a spectacular place to walk around and enjoy. Walking distance to a nearby train station and a ferry. We felt very safe everywhere we went. For people who are taking their first trip to Sydney, ParkRoyal is the place to stay because the staff are so very helpful. Scott Sandoe, the Assistant Chief Concierge, along with the other men working there too at ParkRoyal were so patient and helpful with whatever questions and needs we had. I can't say enough good about the staff. Our room was a corner room so we had two windows, nice bathroom, comfortable bed, and very quiet. Our trip to Sydney and our stay at ParkRoyal were both fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, good value!”
Reviews.Author: PerthHolidayBuff
Reviews.Content: Booked a family deal, room with view of Darling Harbour with 2 dbl beds for only $255 night including scrumptious buffet breakfast for whole family. We sat on our beds and watched the spectacular Australia Day fireworks. Friendly staff (esp the chambermaids), very clean spacious rooms. Location was excellent. Walking distances to Darling Harbour (lots of places to eat and shop), the Sydney Aquarium, Chinatown (lots of places to eat). Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: missdez
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a 5 day girls getaway and chose to stay at the ParkRoyal in Darling Harbour and opted for a Orchid Club Room with two double beds. Upon arriving in the lobby the hotel staff were amazing! so helpful and friendly, we arrived early and while our room wasnt early they allowed us to check in and then be taken up to the club lounge to have a free breakfast. The club lounge is sensational and so glad we paid a little more and chose this option. The staff very friendly in the club lounge. breakfast you chose from a set menu - Pancakes to die for! and they also have a wide selection of cereals, spreads, fruits, drinks and pastries. Coffee is awesome! they have an automatic cappucino machine that really does make a great cup of coffee.. in the club lounge they have drinks, fruit and biscuits available throughout the day... There is computers with free internet for people to use.. Did i mention the view in the club lounge??? Its AMAZING!!! you get a beautiful view over darling harbour. Evening drinks and canapes were great start to the evening! selection of hot and cold foods with some really nice wines, champagnes and beers! The Room! it was good. beds were amazingly comfy! bathroom was adequate. had everything we needed! and a massive big mirror which came in handy with two girls getting ready to go out! room was cleaned daily... The rooms aren't massive but we really didn't stay in our hotel much... Club rooms are on the higher floors so there are no noise from the streets.. We also ordered room service - Midnight snack of a Banana Split - It was amazing... as room service is it's quite expensive but def worth it if you have a sweet tooth. Breakfast - with club access you can either eat in the club lounge or you can go downstairs and enjoy a buffet breakfast - we did this one morning and it was amazing.. wide selection of foods... egg station which i love! heaps of juices... pastries and fruits... This isn't a 5 star hotel but the service and quality you receive it by far the best I've ever received. It's in a good location with across the road being darling harbour which has a heap of nice bars, restaurants and shops... about a 5min walk to the markets and chinatown a couple of blocks away... there's a 7/11 convenience store across the road. I really can not fault this hotel at all everything was just perfect.. The staff really make your stay here better and definitely an asset to the hotel! Next time I goto sydney i'm not even going to bother booking anywhere else - ParkRoyal is and will be my number 1 preference.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly service, well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: seeneysabroad
Reviews.Content: The Parkroyal Darling Harbour is within easy walking distance of the CBD, shopping arcades and railway access to the airport. The rooms are a good size and the hotel is quiet. Built in an atrium style the building is light and reasonably modern. I had an executive room on the Orchid level so had access to the small but friendly lounge on the 9th floor. They serve a good continental breakfast plus free drinks and canapes from 6pm - 8pm. All included in the very reasonable tarriff - for Sydney. I had a room service meal one evening and the food was lovely and served very quickly. The reception desk is friendly and staff made my stay a very pleasant one. While my trip was a business one there seemed to be quiet a few holiday makers because it is only a very short walk to Darling Harbor and only three stops on the underground to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful short stay in Sydney at the Parkroyal”
Reviews.Author: moremusicbuzz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Parkroyal many times, staying six nights this visit and not much changes. It's location is ideal for both Darling Harbour and the city and the local public transport options (train and ferry) are very close by and taxis are right outside the hotel. Our room was quite spacious with kingsize bed, table with chairs plus separate lounge chairs, and included both a shower and bath. We dined two nights and food quality was excellent but do try to have breakfast included in your tariff or you'll add $50 (continental) or $70 (full buffet) per couple per day to your bill! If you fancy a drink after a long day walking and sightseeing, happy hour with two for one drinks is on between 5-7pm week days at the bar/coffee lounge just outside the main entrance. There is much to do in Darling Harbour and I would recommend looking for discount vouchers located in the back of local guides which can be found just as you walk into the hotel. The vouchers offer 15-20% off attractions such as IMAX theatre, Sydney Aquarium, Powerhouse Museum, Maritime Museum and many others plus further afield, Taronga Park Zoo. Definitely recommend walking up to the Town Hall area and visiting the beautiful Queen Victoria Building with a plethora of shopping options and then it's a short walk to the mall with even more choice if you so desire, or alternatively continue on and walk to the Art Gallery of NSW (highly recommended) or the Botanical Gardens, both from which you can walk back around to Circular Quay and then it's a short train ride back to Town Hall or a ferry ride to wherever you decide!

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jackie Y
Reviews.Content: ParkRoyal Darling Harbour will be my hotel of choice in Sydney from now on. The rooms are fabulous and roomy, the staff are great, and the lounge access on the 9th floor was well worth visiting every morning for a light breakfast. The cost is very comparable (and sometimes a lot less) than the other hotels in Sydney that rate around the same. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susie724
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parkroyal on Darling Harbour for four nights last week. This Hotel can not be faulted in my opinion. The room was quiet, the bed comfy, the view amazing, the location perfect but what really stood out for my husband and I was the staff. They were the friendliest staff - nothing was too much trouble. From the cleaning ladies to the front of house staff - really lovely. Will definitely stay again. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well Positioned and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Trudy R
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent room, large and very comfortable. We were slightly concerned because the hotel is positioned near a main road, but we need not have worried as it was quiet and we slept well. The hotel is ideally positioned for getting the best out of Darling Harbour. The concierge was really helpful in advising us on the sights and services of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “1980's nostalgia flash”
Reviews.Author: USPL
Reviews.Content: The first thing that strikes you is the bench along one wall of the room covered in carpet to take your suitcase. I haven't seen that arrangement since Flag Motels in the 1980's and had a sudden nostalgia flash. :) My room was on the sixth floor overlooking Anzac Bridge. No problems with noise from the Cross City Tunnel traffic or Darling Harbour in general. Good: Air conditioning worked well The bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom area Staff and friendly and helpful Comfy bed Excellent location for Darling Harbour or CBD business Not so good: Dated and faded decor Noisy lifts Overpriced breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vesna W
Reviews.Content: The Parkroyal at Darling Harbour is situated in a great location, within walking distance of the city and the Darling harbour area. The hotel was comfortable and clean and overall suited our needs. We chose this hotel as we are GHA card members and unfortunately the hotel staff did not acknowledge our platinum status and we were not offered anything in addition to the original booking. We also asked for adjoining rooms as we had children and this was not provided. The staff stated that this was due to no availability. I love GHA hotels but maybe I am to used to the superior service of the Asian hotels of this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: megamushroom
Reviews.Content: Room is huge and you got a lot of storage space. If you happen got a corner room, that's huge, say 232. I have stayed here 3 times on my last quarters business trips. Bath room is luxury, both shower and bath tub. Though it somewhat look dated, but well maintened. Location is excellent. Up the till towards George Street is Town Hall station, which is the center of the center. It closes to Darling Harbour, which is a throw stone distance. Food choice is abundant around Park Royal, where you can go to China Town in minute.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeteBentley
Reviews.Content: It can be difficult at times to find a good value hotel in Sydney, depending on what events are on. The Park Royal is not super cheap, but is great value for money. The location is fabulous for getting to any part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Sandra252
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two friends stayed here for 4 nights in the middle of January 2012. We had a lovely room with a view of the Harbour. The hotel is well located for both the restaurants on the harbour and in China town. The hotel is very clean and the beds are really comfortable. The hotel has a happy hour Monday to Friday at 5pm were the beer is two for the price of one which is around 6 Australian dollars Be prepared to pay around 35 Australian dollars for a breakfast which works out at around Â£26 at today's exchange rate. Sydney is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: FussyNSW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parkroyal Darling Harbour a couple of weeks ago. Initially we couldn't find it - hence my title, even the Navman couldn't find it, I almost parked in town and got a taxi. However, the search was worth it. I had booked one night as a "secret hotel" so wasn't expecting much, but we were very pleasantly surprised. Our room was on the 10th floor with a lovely view of Darling Harbour. The room was very pleasant and a reasonable size. Room and bathroom were very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Even though a major flyover runs next to the hotel, we could not hear any traffic, all in all it was a very quiet hotel. We didn't use the restaurant as we were meeting family in town for dinner, we did, however, have a drink in the bar before we left. Service in the bar was outstanding. Normally it would be a walk down to Circular Quay and the Opera House, on this night the rain was heavy so we got a taxi - $17 but it was Friday peak hour. Check-in and check out were very easy and the staff were extremely friendly and polite. If you want to park onsite it is by valet parking only at a cost of $40 per night but having taken so long to find it we did not want to venture back out into the public carpark - we would have had to get back out into major traffic in the one way system. Although we thought $40 was expensive, it was worth it for convenience. Concierge again couldn't have been more helpful. I go to Sydney regularly and usually stay at more expensive hotels - we paid $140 for the Parkroyal, however, I would not hesitate to stay there again or to recommend it to family and friends. The management and staff are to be congratulated - they are dong a great job!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room service”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Comedy of errors for room service. Food finally arrived after two hours. I had to convince the hotel that two hours was pretty unacceptable after initially being offered a small "discount" for my trouble. Otherwise the room was actually pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Aussos
Reviews.Content: My family and I (Wife and 2 children under 7 ) recently stayed at the hotel for 4 nights during the Australia Day period. I have stayed at this hotel a view times before for both business and pleasure as it is within walking distance to everything and relatively cheap. I booked well in advance for a good deal and specifically requested the best room I could get with a view of Darling Harbour in order for the kids to view the fireworks. Vicky from reservations is to be thanked for making this happen as this trip was all about the kids..... As you can see in the photo the view was spectacular and the kids loved it so I totally recommend the Orchid Club Darling Harbour Outlook rooms on the 9th floor. Now a couple of things to be aware of : 1.The bath has the spout real low and as my daughter did hit her forehead on it quite badly....2.Room service leaves a little to be desired....3.Avoid room 926 if you do not like to be woken up all the time as the staff door is right opposite it...4.GHA Members need to find out your own information as apparently i am due for some local attractions rewards but reception told me that they can't assist me and you have to do it online, tried that but still awaiting my password in order to access, missed out this time...5. Do not expect 5 star , the rooms need some work. Positives: 1.The lady at the check in assisted me straight away with an icepack for my daughter but funnily enough never asked anymore information on the incident ? 2.The breakfast buffet is great as well as the little bar next to the hotel. 3.The views from the room and location to everything.4.Concierge for recommending & booking my cars and giving us umbrellas to utilise as long as we wanted. 5.Vicky the reservation lady... 6.The price !! Over all very pleasing place and I will continue to stay there and recommend it to all......... as you can tell from my negatives they are only petty and easily avoidable.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star pretending to be 4.”
Reviews.Author: Luapdrareve
Reviews.Content: This property is fine as long as you know what you are getting. A 3 star hotel in a convenient location (easy 10 min walk from Town Hall station and central to all the Darling Harbour highlights), clean comfortable rooms, with average service. There is nothing flash about this place but if you are on business and just sleeping here you won't be too disappointed. My wife and I ordered room service a few times, yuck is the word that springs to mind, the food was awful and our order was mucked up. To the credit of the check out clerk the cost was removed from our bill, that's good service making up for very poor service. This really is a basic hotel but the rate is fair.

Reviews.Title: “Was just fine”
Reviews.Author: Yuki_6
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just stayed here over the weekend for two nights. Our room had two comfy double beds, and the air con worked well. Breakfast buffet was great and we enjoyed having a nice long chat at breakfast in the mornings. The location was ok, was a bit annoying for taxis to drop us off, being right near the freeway. It is really close to the town hall train station which is handy, and walking distance to Chinatown and Darling Houbour (both good spots) room itself was ok, our view was of the freeway :( staff are friendly enough without giving too much. Small things like shampoo and bath gel not great (so didn't take any for the road - not a big deal!) I think the hotel was ok, no bad experiences as such but I've stayed at better places in Sydney which are nicer for the money and better location. Probably won't come back personally..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: girlish_sista
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night whilst visiting Sydney for a friend's birthday. The hotel is conveniently located an easy 5 minute walk to all the attractions of Darling Harbour. For the price, the location is hard to beat. Others in the area charge premium prices and offer less than impressive service. The room (a standard queen) was spacious and the bathroom had a seperate shower, which I always appreciate. Views are a non event, but then so are most in this area. The included buffet breakfast was great - an omelette chef that also poached eggs on demand, fresh juice bar, espresso coffee machine (complimentary) and cheese selection all added to the appeal. If I had one complaint it would be that the parking it expensive. $28 for self parking and $45 for valet, but then it is Sydney so to be expected. I would happily return and reccommend to anyone wanting a good quality hotel, close to all the amenities of Darling Harbour at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: FoxAndEgg
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth hotel I'd stayed in within Sydney, and so I feel like I am able to compare it well with the experience of other hotels in the city. This hotel was the best value for the money that I've encountered in Sydney. It was clean, the service was excellent, and the location was extremely convenient to commute anywhere in Sydney. We could walk most anywhere we wanted to go, but there was easy access to the trains and ferries as well. There are a tremendous number of wonderful restaurants in very close proximity, and plenty of touristy stuff to do quite close by. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. The only thing I didn't love was that the buffet breakfast was extremely expensive, but breakfast in Australia seems to be priced much higher than in the US on the whole.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Liv_in_0z
Reviews.Content: We booked 6-8 weeks before we were planning on traveling, and requested two separate beds when we booked. We arrived only to be told that there were no twin rooms left, and we would either have to share a bed, or they could provide a single roll away. I wouldn't have minded so much if we had been notified in advance that they were booked out with regards to the twin bed rooms, however no one bothered to contact us at all. After a bit of complaining the check-in staff agreed to upgrade the bed to a king size. Room was average, and didn't really cool down much with the air con on. Bathroom was OK. Bed was comfortable. Room service was expensive and disappointing. I ordered a pizza and chips and the pizza was refrigerator cold. The cheese on it hadn't even had a chance to brown! We had breakfast included in our room rate. Breakfast was very nice, they have a good variety and even an omelet chef on hand to cook it as you like. Location is good. Right across the road from Darling Harbor. I would however choose to stay somewhere else in future, as I am sure that you can find a better hotel especially when you are paying this sort of money.

Reviews.Title: “Suited to the International Traveller”
Reviews.Author: LizzyLeeton
Reviews.Content: The location is fine but there are no views really of Darling Harbour. It is on the edge of the city and borders Darling Habour. Room was fine with a great and spacious bathroom and the beds and pillows were outstanding. We had a corner room which gave us a bit of a 180 degree panoramic view but there wasn't much to see! The downstairs bar was fine but service was a little strectched but to be fair there was a large group in. You could walk to most city locations but it struck me that it would be an ideal hotel for an international tourist as opposed to staying in the city for the weekend. Parking is an issue - you have to walk a block or so to the parking station or pay big money for valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price, good location, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Torom
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three days including NY eve and it was last minute booking. It is a kind of average hotel everyone will experience. But I found room was clean, hotel staffs are helpful and amongst the all, location is really good. Only hotel parking was expensive, but parking in Sydney CBD is expensive though. We found a parking just around the corner (I think it was next to Oaks hotel) twice cheaper than hotel one which hotel staff suggested.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't care”
Reviews.Author: Mad9044
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights between Christmas and New Year 2011 The parking was $45.00 per night!! Wow, the beds were hard and the sheets dirty, the pillows were so soft we ended up using the chair cushions. The first afternoon we returned to our room they had left a pile of rubbish that they forgot to take and all the bed pillows were on the floor??? (We put the chair cushions back every morning) on the subsequent days after our return to the room housekeeping was almost non existent they didnâ€™t make the beds properly or replace the shampoo and other consumables that were used the day before. On our last night we were woken by the smell of cigarette smoke it was permeating our room from the gap under the adjoing room door (The hotel is a non smoking establishment) when we alerted the desk staff and supplied the room number the smoke was coming from they didnâ€™t really care.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: Wishlist
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Parkroyal on the 10th floor over looking Darling Harbour. The location is excellent for walking around Darling Harbour, IMAX theatre, Cockle Bay, Aquarium and the Pitt st Mall and Westfield shopping complex, centre point tower and QVB. Also not too far to the George st cinemas and Paddys markets. We did also walk down to the Rocks and Circular Quay but if walking isn't your thing you can catch the free city shuttle bus which does a loop around the CBD. Our room was clean with a kingside bed, desk, one single lounge and footstool, mini bar fridge, safe, flat screen TV. WiFi unfortunately was not free as it should be these days. The bathroom supplied robes and the usual shampoos etc. separate shower and bath tub. The room had a large picture window with the lovely view but you do need to stand to see out. We visited both bars and service was excellent. The downstairs bar had happy hour with a two for one deal on their drinks. You don't see this great value too frequently these days. Thanks Parkroyal. One negative was the cost of valet parking per night of $45. Outrageous! However they do give you the option to park your car yourself around the corner in a secure public parking area which we did for two of the three nights. This was $28 per day. Yes we would stay here again if we can get a special deal as its pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_J_IR
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney for work and stayed here..The biggest advantage of this hotel is the location. You can walk to all major attractions and it is very convenient in terms of taking a train or getting a cab. Unlike some other hotels it is slightly off darling harbour..however, its just a 2 min walk to harbour if you want to go there. The rooms are very comfortable and staff is courteous and helpful. The dining facilities are pretty good. Good breakfast spread and one thing worth mentioning is the staff offering to make cappuccino from the coffee machine and serving on the table..something you don't see at most hotels. They also have a club lounge but apart from that no other facilities like spa, pool, etc. which makes it not the best option for someone who is on a holiday or looking for a luxury hotel. Overall a nice hotel with friendly staff and perfect for a business visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great quality”
Reviews.Author: JPHfromDK
Reviews.Content: Are you looking for a central location with most attractions in Sydney within walking distance, go for Parkroyal at Darling Harbour. You will get a high quality hotel with a superb location for a fair price.We stayed 2 nigths with 3 teenagers and used the hotel as platform for our Sydney visit. Just across a walkingbridge you will be in Darling Harbour with its huge numbers of restaurants and cafes. Take the opportunity to visit Chinese Garden for Friendship - it is wortwhile. Within 10 minuttes walk you will find China Town, Queen Victoria Building & Town Hall, Hide Park or Paddy Markets. Are you traveling with smaller children you will find a great play ground just 5 minuttes away by crossing the walkingbridge to Darling Harbour. We found the breakfast pricess too high 25-35 AUD but you can find a lot of fine alternatives close by in the harbour area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swissie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights as a family of four having booked 2 rooms through the hotel directly. We booked a last minute package which included free breakfast and club lounge access. We stayed in a king bedded room, I think we were upgraded. Both hotel rooms were clean, spacious, well maintained with modern fixtures and furniture. Bathrooms were very extremely spacious. The sound insulation was astounding, considering that our room overlooked the very busy Darling Harbour overpass which runs directly beside the hotel. My husband and I are frequent hotel stayers, and this hotel definitely sets it apart from other 4.5 star hotels. The little things that really made a difference to us were: the magazines in the foyer, the availability of newspaper in the foyer and delivered to the room by request (something that is becoming increasingly rare these days). Breakfast each morning could not be faulted. Great range, presentation was superb, as well as the standard selection you would expect from a 4.5 star hotel, in addition there was smoked salmon, berries, cheese selection, fresh figs and other fresh fruits. There was a true fresh bean coffee machine and the staff were even offering to make you a cappuccino from the coffee machine in the bar at no extra cost which was a nice and very much appreciated service. The club lounge was excellent - it provided a nice relaxing environment and free alcoholic drinks and canapes between 6-8pm and a range of cold drinks and coffee at all other times. I joined their hotel association before we arrived and as a member received free WIFI access. Overall a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “not quite what i was after”
Reviews.Author: isyns
Reviews.Content: Booked via Wotif secret deal for 2 nights (sat/sun) for $170/night for 2 x double bed room. Fifth floor. Room size was pretty good. Beds were very comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Interior of the hotel (e.g. hallway) seems tired (colours and some wall damage). Bathroom was a bit disappointing - shower door did not align and we had a visitor (cockroach - however this is Sydney so not surprised on the latter). We were upgraded upon check-in but I wasn't too sure to what - we originally booked a 2 x double bed room (which we got) so maybe it was room size or Darling Harbour view (well, a view of the road actually)? We were hoping for a pool but it doesn't have one - I guess the risk you take with secret deals. Proximity to Darling Harbour was OK. A lot of new cafes and restaurants in Darling Quarter just across the road. Don't think it was the best value for the price. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city stay”
Reviews.Author: tiroli
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here on a quick overnight stay in Sydney. We found the room very clean and spacious, especially the bathroom. The location was so central to everything we had planned and right near hundreds of lovely restaurants. The staff were lovely and the deal we secured online made the stay very affordable too. Very comfortable and will certainly consider staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Functional but hardly 4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: pm1967
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spoil ourselves every few months with a weekend/overnighter in the city, usually we take in a show or indulge in a decent meal. This time round we went to the Star theatre so stopped at the Park Royal as it overlooks Darling Harbour. Initial impressions were good with a pleasant and airy entrance with friendly staff, we were even able to check in early so a great start. The room, an Orchid Club suite was clean and tidy with an excellent view of the harbour however it felt basic and tired with very few of the room facilities that are the norm for similar quality hotels or suites. Woodwork with paint splashes, marks on the walls, chips in several pieces of furniture and cracks in the tiling grout show a lack of care over an extended period. There is also a distinct lack of storage space in the room which given the size is strange. One drawer and a single wardrobe was ok for us but if we had been staying longer or brought more clothes it wouldn't have been enough. Orchid club is very pleasant and worth the extra but for some reason the computer system for our room details didn't include access until the staff doubled checked. Breakfast buffet was excellent and included in the deal along with late check out. Overall a nice hotel with friendly staff but given the standard of our room more suited to the business visit than those looking for a bit of luxury

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Central Location.”
Reviews.Author: Booper97
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight stay for a family getaway. Booked online and had a very good rate for a room with views of Darling Harbour which was clean, comfortable and very quiet. However, if I'd paid the full rack rate (supposedly $500) I would have expected better.Great location - can leave the car and walk to all major attractions.Opted for the Valet parking at the hotel which was $45 for 24hours.If I stayed there again I would use the parking stations around the corner as they worked out significantly cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: smileyfacegrace
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location and the staff are super friendly! I noticed the rooms were fairly spacious and the washrooms had a lot of counter space which was nice to lay out all of our stuff. Enjoyed my visit and I liked how everything was within walking distance. Good value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Seagreen75
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. It looks recently renovated and rooms are bright, spacious and well equiped. Staff were very friendly, and while it was really busy during my stay, they were still very helpful and accommodating. It's a little walk from Darling Harbour itself, but the upside of that is it's closer to the CBD. I didn't dine at the hotel, so can't rate that experience, but there are plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby so there's lots of dining options to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “A must to consider”
Reviews.Author: Petracca
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and attended a function at Dockside and would come back again. The rooms were clean, modern and found the service to be excellent. There are so many great restuarants to choose from at Darling Harbour and an easy stroll back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for short family weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: giddyup123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our kids (3 & 5 yrs) earlier this month. We had a jam packed 2 days doing activities in the city (fish markets, movies, monorail, chinatown, big christmas tree and luna park). This was a great location to get about Sydney and fit it all in. The room was quiet modern and clean, not noisy. The staff were very attentive, the parking is a bit pricey (but we are in the city), but for the valet service it was great to get it in and out for us as we needed it. The breakfast was fabulous, heaps of choices, very yummy. We would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “close to central places”
Reviews.Author: basaa
Reviews.Content: The lobby is not very inviting but rooms are warm & cozy. The breakfast menu has a wide variety of choice for international travelers. The location is close to many attractions and there is a short cut to get onto business district. The convention center and Darling Harbor is just 5 minutes on foot. I had a great time going out in the morning for a long run around the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: kazda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a 5 minutes walk at the most to the Imax theatre. It is situated on the 'newer' side of Darling Harbour. The bed was comfortable with plenty of room in the bathroom with a bath and separate shower cubicle. Breakfast was included in our rate but it is normally $35.00 each, which I think is a bit expensive when it's just the standard eggs, bacon, toast, fruit etc and their coffee is not the best tasting. We used the valet service at $45.00 rather than parking the car around the corner in a public car park which at the time we were there was $28.00 overnight. At checkout there was a small queue but the the Manager was making his way along the line and checking out people who were happy to have their room charges made directly against their credit card rather than waiting to be served by the front desk staff. The only gripe i have is they charge 1.5 percent card processing fee if your paying your bill by credit card which is NOT the standard procedures used by other hotels or shops for that matter when your using your credit card to make payment. Over all a good hotel, just a shame they feel the need to pass on the card processing fees to their clients.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bigGNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a lower level twin room. I thought road noise might have been a problem as it was very close to major roads and on ramps but they obviously have hush glass fitted as you the rooms were very sound proof. Very clean and tidy room that was serviced daily. Helpful friendly staff. A short walk accross the overbridge to Darling Harbour. There is a taxi rank next to hotel and staff will call a taxi to hotel to pick you up and help with your bags. It was approx $50AUD for the taxi to the International Airport. Stayed here on a very busy long weekend and never had any problem with service or facilities. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Edster88
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious & clean. Just 3 minutes walk across a pedestrian bridge to Darling Harbour. Breakfast is quite sumptuous. Service is good with a welcoming reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BM2759
Reviews.Content: Great service. Great hotel. Stayed in a single room with a queen size bed. Only downside is the bathroom vent didn't work so after showering the water vapour hangs around for far too long. It's only a minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: 186284Liz
Reviews.Content: The Parkroyal is in an ideal situation near Darling Harbour with all its restaurants and shops. Although our room was at the back of the hotel, it was quiet, clean & spacious. Having arrived after a long flight from the UK at 0900, were very pleased when the hotel receptionist said we could move straight into our room even though strictly speaking we shouldnâ€™t have been able to check in until at least 1400. This meant we could shower & unpack before starting our exploration of Sydney. Canâ€™t comment on the food as we didnâ€™t eat in the hotel because it appeared to be very pricey and the Darling Harbour restaurants were only a short walk away. Would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “good quality but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: malonely
Reviews.Content: Parkroyal is a good quality four star hotel but the parking is not cheap and not convenient. There is only valet parking as the car park is up the street so there is a charge of $45 each time you access the car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicola F
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights and had a wonderful time. We paid for the upgrade to the Orchid Club, which meant we had a room on the 9th floor with a view of Darling Harbour. The room had two large very comfortable double beds and a large bathroom with a bath and a shower. It was cleaned every day to a very high standard and all the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The Orchid Club allows you to have free drinks and canapes every evening in a room overlooking Darling Harbour. The room was very quiet even with a main road outside and the restaurant food was absolutely delicious. The hotel is in a great location. About a 3 minute walk from Darling Harbour and about a 5 minute walk from the CBD where it is easy to get a bus down to Circular Quay and the Bridge and Opera House. The concierge was extremely helpful as were the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel but don't ask the staff for anything”
Reviews.Author: milanovictraveller
Reviews.Content: My brother and i stayed in this hotel on the last week of November. I rang up the hotel to get directions to the hotel from the airport via the train. I was given the instructions which we followed, we were told that it was only a 5 minute walk, its NOT! The beds were comfy but the pillows were rock hard, the room is not well lit in certain areas of the room, the tv was pretty small. We were give a "city scape" room. Which really meant that we were looking at a brick wall or into someone elses apartment. There seemed to be no aussies working in the hotel, all forginers who could barely speak english. My brother and I went to the concierge and the front desk to ask some questions and they couldn't give us a straight answer or that of what we wanted. Hello that's not what I asked!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Park Royal Hotel with Valet parking only”
Reviews.Author: Peggy_Pegster
Reviews.Content: This Park Royal hotel in Darling Harbour, Sydney, just like the other Park Royal hotels in the world, is a fine one keeping in line with its standards as a 4 - 5 stars hotel. It is clean, comfortable located conveniently by Darling Harbour, 8 mins walk from Chinatown, 10 mins walk away from Town Hall Station and 15 - 20 mins walk away from Hyde Park. Although it doesn't boast the best views (located right by the highway, ANZ bridge) the central location makes it a worthwhile stay. In fact, if your room does face Darling Harbour - you can enjoy a 10 min fireworks display, which takes place on certain Saturdays of the week, in the comfort of your own room. Though my room was sfacing the highway, I am pleasantly surprised that there is almost 0 traffic noise in the rooms. Those of you whom are driving - please note that this hotel only allows valet parking which cost 45 AuD per parking even though you are the guest of the hotel. Nothing to scream about regards to the stay, but certainly a comfortable one

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WAtraveler75
Reviews.Content: After that ugly flight of 15 hours from LAX to Sydney, we checked in to the Park Royal Hotel around 10:30am. Normal check in is 2:00pm, but after that flight we were quite tired. The hotel was very accomodating by giving us the room early with no extra charge. The hotel is nicer than the pictures indicated on-line, so we were pleasantly surprised. The location is virtually across the street from Darling Harbour, although you have to walk a bit to cross all of the streets. The location is perfect for exploring the Harbour area. We walked from the hotel to the Rocks, Harbour Bridge and Opera House, but it is a bit of a treck. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We booked 3 nights and got the 4th night free. A great place after looking at many on-line during the planning phase.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: OzKat
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms, but noisiest hotel in Sydney! Amazingly it's not the close by freeway, nor the site works behind the hotel, it's the sound of kitchen staff preparing meals and tickling plates at 3am in the morning that keeps you awake. All of the rooms circle a central atrium that looks over the restaurant. Avoid this hotel if you want a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice position”
Reviews.Author: Thewearyone
Reviews.Content: Well located close to Darling Harbour and transport. Pleasant room. Check-in staff efficient. Breakfast over priced and very average. Complimentary magazines in foyer were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hardnut59
Reviews.Content: Hotel handy to all city & harbour attractions - all within walking distance. Good clean hotel with all usual facilities and amenities. Only negative were paper thin walls. Could hear other guests on either side and doors in corridor slamming. Stayed 4 nights and we were very happy overall with cleanliness and friendliness of staff

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Winrise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ParkRoyak Darling Harbour for three nights, and found it to be perfect for our group of mainly senior citizens. It is only minutes walk to top restaurants and Darling Harbour. We ate in-house the first night of three nights, and the buffet was superb. Helpful staff, and plenty of them to attend to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for our stay”
Reviews.Author: laced
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and took advantage of the savings on accommodation. We booked through the hotel's website. Very quick reasonably priced trip by taxi to the hotel from the airport. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Imax and Darling Harbour and is perfect for a visit to this region. Its situation in a 'cul-de-sac' makes for easy drop-off and pick-up. We found all the staff very pleasant and welcoming. The room was surprisingly large and the bed was very comfortable. All amentities within the room were excellent. No problems to either eat in or walk to the Harbour area with its many choices of food. We would stay there again if in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Central yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: jkl615
Reviews.Content: Being ~5 minute walking distance away from the Darling Harbour, not being directly over the harbourside makes this hotel relatively economical to stay in. From our room we enjoyed a glimpse of the water and Novotel building over the more close-by highway and highway entrance. The room we've got was quiet and clean. The bathroom showed its age although very clean also. For a central location, it was relatively good value and comfortable. We parked our car at nearby public parking tower at a reduced rate of $28 per 24hrs and because of its close proximity to the hotel, we decided not to use the late check-out we've got as part of the deal we booked for and opted for luggage storage for the time we went strolling about and picking up the car. The staff was very professional and helpful both at the front desk and at the conciege.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DrScotto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parkroyal for 2 nights attending a meeting that was being held in the hotel. The facilities for the meeting were very good with things seemed to go off without a hitch. The food provided by the hotel we excellent. The room I stayed in was fairly standard with a large flat screen TV and minibar at the usual prices. Robes were supplied as well as ironing board and iron. The bed was very comfortable and there was little noise from the street, although the bathroom next door was a little loud at times. Breakfast was the usual buffet style but above average in quality. Dinner was buffet style as well organised for our meeting, and again the quality of the food was above average and enjoyable. i did not try any of the dishes from the ala carte menu so can not comment. The location is great, on the edge of Darling Harbour and the CBD with trains only a few minutes walk from the hotel itself. Two stops from Town Hall station and you are at Circular Quay for all the ferry connections. We also found a couple of great bars only a short walk away as well.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: evertonbilly
Reviews.Content: Noisy, can hear noise clearly from next room. Beds were not that comfy to be honest. But for the price that was paid for the accomodation was still value for Money. would only stay again if I had that reduced rate

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: foreveritalian
Reviews.Content: we had a three night stay, staff were very efficient, especially concierge chris who was very helpful. Our room was very spacious and very clean, the buffet breakfast which was included in our stay was amazing, the hotel is in the most perfect location , in front of hotel 1 minute walk across the road is beautiful darling harbour , with all the shopping, cafes , imax, convention centre, monorail,restaurants, aquarium, ferrys, attractions and much more, behind the hotel is the city,with all the shopping and sights all close by and walking distance, town hall station is a 3 minute walk, which is very handy also to get to and from the airport, we loved every minute of our stay and we will stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Mick062
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 arrived after 23 hr flight from Ireland at 07:30 mid august 2011. Exhausted and not looking forward to waiting till 12 for check-in. What a stroke of luck, a young Irish man named Mitchell [I think] at reception, took us under his wing and organised an early check-in and he even got us inter-connecting rooms. While he was checking us in he even showed the children/teenagers in our group a little room beside reception where they could go online and catch up with their friends on facebook! Well done young man! The rest of the staff were just as helpful and this hotel is ideally situated for a bit of sightseeing around Sydney. I would certainly stay there again. Top marks! Bit of confusion over the name so it might be safer to have the address also.

Reviews.Title: “Worn-down old property at a great location”
Reviews.Author: AashishSharma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Royal for 3 nights and the experience was mixed. The location is fantastic - bang across Darling Harbour... close to all the attractions, night-life. They also had Wired/Wireless Internet included in my package. The hotel seems to be quite old and worn-down. The suite style rooms have an outdated decor and the bathrooms seemed to have been used a lot over the years! The view from the room was also nothing to rave about. The breakfast was average and was included in our package. I would recommend this place only for the location (and if you get a good deal online).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: deetone1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights at the Park Royal and thought it was excellent. The location is sensational, being so close to everything on offer at Darling Harbour. Booking in and out was seamless and the reception staff were so polite and helpful. We enquired about a couple of things with the concierge and nothing was too much trouble. Our room on the 10th floor was large and very well appointed. I really couldn't complain about anything. I would book again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - couldn't fault a thing, highly recommend!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CB00_11
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved our stay at the PARKROYAL Darling Harbour - couldn't fault a thing. Staff were AMAZING, each and every encounter with staff showed the highest levels of customer service and nothing was too much trouble. They went above and beyond to help with any query, and a smile was always at the ready and it was greatly appreciated - levels of service like this are lost at most hotels in this day and age so it was refreshing to have such a wonderful experience in terms of service. The room itself was amazing, spacious, clean, comfortable and the bathroom was fantastic - separate shower and bath and very spacious. The view was incredible, the city lights were beautiful. So pleased with the room and couldn't fault anything about it. Loved it and a great home away from home. Location is brilliant, literally a short walk to Darling Harbour and so close to the city aswell. Overall, I would rate the PARKROYAL 10/10 and will DEFINITELY be staying there again, one of the best hotels going around and overall the entire experience was fantastic. Only complaint - wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Noodlie066
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice, with a â€œcity viewâ€�, really the freeway, but the lights at night were nice. The bed was a bit saggy and the towels were OK. There was a little street noise. The concierge was helpful with bus info and helping us reconfirm our airport shuttle. We joined the GHA upon check in, since you get free WiFi with it. We had problems logging in, getting through about 70% of the time. I mentioned this upon check out and was informed they were aware of the problem and were having a wiring upgrade next year. A very nice buffet breakfast was included in my package. Omelets were made to order, there was a juice bar, and quite a few hot dishes, lox, salami, etc. Itâ€™s close to Darling Harbour and a pleasant 20 min. walk to Circular Quay. I would give the room itself 3*, but the buffet breakfast bumps our stay to 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles-in-Oz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a 92 year old lady, who uses a walking frame to get around. The room was large enough to allow her to move around easily. The bathroom was also large enough. We booked at the ParkRoyal because it was one of just a few Sydney Hotels with a separate walk-in shower. The only disappointment was that I had asked for a shower chair on the phone when I booked, but nothing had been done when we checked in. It wasn't until the next morning that this was organised & I again had to go down & see the concierge to get it done. It was expensive though...$35 hire & $50 for delivery & pickup. The in-room dining was really nice...good quality, hot & delivered well within the time frame. The hotel is well situated to Darling harbour, with disabled access excellent...lifts at each walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location.”
Reviews.Author: Aglassofredplease
Reviews.Content: This was one of those "mystery" deals that turned out well. The hotel is above average - clean, quiet, nice staff, fresh apples every day. The room rate made the deal well above average. I had to extend my stay and the front desk offered me the same rate as the "mystery" rate - bonus! The location was excellent for walking - the Darling Harbour recreation zone, King Street Wharf food/drink area, the CBD and down to Circular Quay and the Rocks. Difficult to access by car given the tangle of one way streets, motorways and bridges. The hotel room was nice and quiet though. I would recommend it for city business, but not for anyone who doesn't like (or can't handle) walking hills, steps etc. Small lobby with limited seating - if you are waiting for transport/meeting. I don't think it would suit kids...

Reviews.Title: “Awsome location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Prankss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within a 6minute walk to Darling Harbour (and the hop on hop off bus stop) and a 10min walk to the George Street (shopping, dining, sydney tower). If you are there over the weekend...then the weekend market can be a 20 min walk from the hotel. The staff is helpful and the food is good too though we landed up eating more at cafes and dining places around Opera house, George Street and Darling Harbour. The rooms are abso neat and clean and spacious enough though you have to keep in mind its not luxurious. We stayed on the 5th floor though initially we were checked in on the first floor. But we changed the room cos they were on the road, noisy and cramped. Def recommend cos of location. We were lucky to get a great price for this kind of hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “We were very lucky tomget such a great deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisahmarie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel the morning that we were going to arrive with a mystery deal and got a pretty good bargain!! We arrived very early and lucky we were able to check in. I'm not sure we would have stayed here if we didn't get it at the price we did (almost half price) Our room was lovely and tidy. Only a few issues, the bathroom was a little bit old looking and stains on the tiles. The lift was seriously slow just after we checked in and we ended up sneaking into the service lift. We aren't to snobby so we didn't mind! We just want to enjoy the sun down at the harbor!!! Beds were fabulously comfortable after 2 days of heavy partying - they were just what our bodies needed!! The bath tub was fantastic also- perfect length for the tall person!! We splurged and got an in room movie (just a new release) it was slightly pricey but enjoyable all the same. We didn't use the restaurant or any of the other facilities but I'm sure that they would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, but questionable value”
Reviews.Author: Tree1234
Reviews.Content: Located just adjacent to Darling Harbour, this hotel is located in between a number of major roads. If your looking for a quite hotel, look somewhere else. This hotel hotel has been refurbished, but the overall standard of cleanliness and care are lacking. Its a tired Sydney hotel that does not represent what a Parkroyal use too. However the breakfast offered a grest selection of food and beverages. If your desperate for a central city location, just don't expect a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Conferences and Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Russell087
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had a name change to the ParkRoyal, I think it may have been Crown Plaza. The rooms are large-ish, some with harbour views. I stayed 3 nights for a conference. The 3rd night I dined in the restaurant which serves very ggod and reasonably priced meals. The bar downstairs is a little pricy but comfortable and the staff are very pleasant. Breakfasts were of high quality ebven if the cogffee was typical of all hotels. Not great! The hotel is quiet, even though it is adjacent to main roads, and is an easy walk to Darling Harbour via elevated pedestrian bridges. Apart form a great place to access conferences, its very close to the IMAX cinema and everything else that Darling Harbour has to offer. If you're from out of town and want to stay here I suggest a GPS to find the street if you are driving yourself. Otherwiswe there's planty of taxis and they line up for you in the morning from about 6am. Thoroughly recommended for business or pleasure travellers. The parking is a bit pricey at $AUD45/per nightr but cheaper than most car parks around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: beachcouple2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for one night when having a night out in the city. Got a great deal through wotif and was very pleased with everything. Room was spotless, modern, sophisticated and very spacious. Didn't take advantage of any facilities such as restaurant and gym but no complaints at all. Only irksome thing (which is not limited to this hotel and is becomiing worryingly common in Sydney) is the surcharge if paying by credit card. Another way to squeeze a bit more from the punters, but do they realise how bad a taste it leaves with customers? How else are travellers going to pay for high cost things such as hotels? Credit card fees are a cost of business and I find it very cheeky and annoying to have to pay any extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Tunnster_73
Reviews.Content: We will definitely be back here next time. Everything was fantastic and the staff couldn't do enough for us. The location of this hotel makes it a great base for all city activities.

Reviews.Title: “simply ok”
Reviews.Author: chantal26
Reviews.Content: The one main thing about this hotel is the location to main attractions is fantastic. Now for the downfalls... - The concierge wasnâ€™t valuable at all. We asked him what times the Glebe Markets were on he said they finish at 11am so you better hurry down there. We got there early to find out they didnâ€™t open until 10am and ran for a majority of the day. Other suggestions he had showed he wasnâ€™t extremely competent at his job, which was unfortunate. - The sleep quality wasnâ€™t too bad, really bad pillows. - Breakfast I found was diverse but everything was quite bland and there were definitely no stand outs. Accommodation fine for a 1-2 night stay anything longer and you may need to find alternate accom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent/Central Location, Clean!”
Reviews.Author: dabears-mv81
Reviews.Content: First trip to Australia and was greeted with great hospitality and service. Rooms were very clean and I could not ask for a better location. Close to the Warf (Quay in Aussie) and a short walk to the rail station I never had any issues finding transportation. I do not know the nightly rate as the hotel was booked as part of a package. Concierge service was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Slightly Above Average”
Reviews.Author: mlee9097
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located in city centre with a short walk to Darling Harbour (restaurants, Sydney Aquarium and ferries). Rooms were large and had modern furnishings. However, rooms were a bit dated. Hotel was built some time ago and rooms could use some renovation. It could be cleaner and more kept up given it's self-proclaimed 4.5 star rating. Need to verify charges before checking out. We were charged breakfast and internet even though they were included in the room rate. The front desk quickly corrected the problem. Concierge was helpful with recommending excursions. Breakfast buffet was good quality with plenty of choices.

Reviews.Title: “CITY2SURF RUN/WALK”
Reviews.Author: ozzycruisers
Reviews.Content: Gr8 location right opposite Darling Harbor, Cockle Bay Cafe precinct & 2 blocks from Chinatown. Very quite location for sleeping ie NO street noise - but walls a little thin , could hear people in next room talking and TV but after 10pm not a problem! We got a deal thru the internet ... the hotel is not super flash but is super clean and gr8 value for money. Trific location! Early check in and late check out no problem. We spent 2 days in Sydney ... for the City2surf run all good value.

Reviews.Title: “Almost prefect, but surcharge credit cards”
Reviews.Author: WizardMelbourne
Reviews.Content: An overnight business stay at the Parkroyal Darling Harbour was fine, a room upgrade, high floor, good views, low outside noise, efficient check in and out, all spoiled by the penny pinching surcharge of my credit card. First the good points. Very close to Darling Harbour, where I needed to be, just a short walk from the exhibitions centre. The booking was made direct with the hotel, through a live reservation person, not through the web site as this was playing up. I was asked for my credit card details and this was given and accepted without question or comment. Prompt check in and convinced by the receptionist to join the Parkroyal frequent user programme. For this I would get a room upgrade this visit, plus 2 free bottles of water, normal value $5.00 each. Not a bad deal so I joined. I was asked for my credit card as room guarantee and this was accepted also without question or comment. Nice high room, overlook Darling Harbour, with great views, little or no road noise, clean and comfortable bed. Prompt check out, but on tendering my credit card again for final payment was blythly informed a surcharge would be added. The insidious surcharging of credit cards is just wrong. Having been in the card and hospitailty industry for many years I know hotels have always included card costs in their overheads and this surchraging is just a quick way to make more money. This hotel had two chances to inform me of their card surcharging policy, on reservation and on check in, they chose not to do so, I guess so as not to lose a booking. (they would have lost me) I have now come acrooss this card surcharging twice in recent months in Australia, and no where else in my frequent travlels. The cost is small, for now, but like all surcharges, they grow, (Think flight fuel surcharges) The hotel was fine for the stay and if you don't mind being ripped off by extra charges for using a credit card, this hotel will serve your purposes well, if you object to a card surcharge look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “New favourite at Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: EJHSydney
Reviews.Content: From the elegant and comfortable foyer, with comfy chairs, newspapers and magazines and friendly, efficient staff, to the upgraded room (with a Darling Harbour view - otherwise no different from my colleagues' rooms), this hotel delighted. I have recently tried a few places around Darling Harbour, and they were all fine, but this was the finest. It's on the Cockle Bay side, is good value and has a pleasant 'feel' to it . The room was comfortable and very clean, with many pillows. I don't like doonas, and it took me a while to track the blanket down to its resting place in a drawer, but it was there. I had two comfortable arm chairs and a desk chair, a long desk and a small table, a good TV with controls that worked from the bed, lights that were generally well-located (and some of which had dimmers), responsive heating, drawer storage (once the blanket came out), two large mugs for tea, and a safe. Bathroom large and bright, with a long bench and a separate shower. It would be helpful to have a shelf in the shower for holding shampoo and conditioner; there is only the floor or the high walls. Generous with towels and products. Very minor downside: the really odd artwork on the walls of our rooms. Looked like a blow-up of a few brightly-coloured amoeba. Not my taste, but not significant in the scheme of things.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with nice service”
Reviews.Author: EllyT14
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning (around 6 am) and got access to the room at once. Very nice since the night flight was tiresome and we were awfully tired arriving in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “If you need service dont bother!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: papas1983
Reviews.Content: We had to request for items we needed so many time but room service did not bother to service our needs. We had to contantly ask for things that our room needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Jamoz23
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel as a package deal to see Mary Poppins. Received one night free, but paid to upgrade to a Darling Harbour view room, well worth it especially as the boat show was being set up for that weekend. Hotel was in a great location, now that the Darling Quarter is nearly finished it was an easy and scenic walk to get across to the Powerhouse Museum or to Paddyâ€™s Market. It was also an easy walk to Darling Harbour (Cockle Bay) via the Quarter instead of over the walkway. George and Pitt Streets and Chinatown were also an easy walking distance. Circular Quay and The Rocks were only a 20 minute walk or you can get the free city shuttle from George street. Town Hall train station was a five minute walk away offering easy direct access to/from the airport. Room was clean with good amenities, bathrobes, room safe, iron & board, tea coffee making facilities. Staff were extremely polite and helpful, did not eat in the hotel as, hey, in Sydney with the rocks and harbour to choose from let alone all the great restaurants in the CBD. Hotel is offering shuttles to/from the airport $1.00 cheaper but it stops at other hotels and therefore takes longer compared to the airport train which is only $15.00 and so easy to this hotel. Airport to Town Hall station 25 mins then a 5 min walk. I was told hotel is due to be refitted next year and a pool added which will be great. Have stayed in Sydney before but we will be returning to the Parkroyal due to the location and staff. Only complaint was the pillows were like rocks but as I did not ask about changing them I am not sure if they have a variety.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location but unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: thatkiwijoker
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have stayed in this hotel and although it was clean and in a great location apart from the cleaning staff the rest were grumpy and unfriendly

Reviews.Title: “Great location for conferences but basic with poor service”
Reviews.Author: baselgirl_1000
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located for conferences at Darling Harbour but is pretty average. Only positive was wireless in the room but only one device at a time which makes sense but is a pain. Service was terrible - we were there as a big group for work and had really little support. Rooms had to be re- cleaned, packages went missing, we had to re-check all the meeting rooms everyday and the list goes on. They had just changed owners and it showed. Things can go wrong but they handled it really badly. I wouldn't go back for work or recommend it for companies holding meetings. We removed it from our preferred suppliers list.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay for access to conferences at Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: 255068Paul
Reviews.Content: I was a presenter at a conference at Darling Harbour and booked a city view room at the Parkroyal. Staff at the Parkroyal were helpful and accommodating. The room was comfortable and had a desk big enough to write on and operate a laptop comfortably and the room had free internet access through the hotel's loyalty program which I was invited to join on arrival. Just a pleasant five minute walk to the conference venue, I couldn't have stayed in a better place. My wife joined me for the weekend and the room was big enough for both of us.

Reviews.Title: “OK would only stay if the price was right”
Reviews.Author: Casscruise2
Reviews.Content: The location is quite good, the rooms were good and clean - what we didn't like was the surly person at reception when checking in - the other staff subsequently were pleasant and helpful - but had a few minor issues which together added up to a somewhat underwhelming experience so would only stay here again if we came across a really good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Just Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: JakiWestYorkshire
