Reviews.Content: Hotel in a excellent position for the Harbour, Rooms were lovely and clean and spacious, and the staff were very nice and friendly the Hair dryer blew up when I was using it. they could not do enough for me for the rest of my stay. the reception was very helpful with any information you might want.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smilerneil
Reviews.Content: Decent location if you want to be close to Darling Harbour, rooms and bathrooms are huge, service is good. Decor is a touch tired/well used, but all in all it is a value for money offering.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tjw3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here so we could attend the good food and wine show. The location is fantastic. Just a 2 min walk to Darling Harbour. We received a free room upgrade and were able to check into a room at 9:30 am. I was so happy. Thought we would have to leave our stuff in the car while we attended the show. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was good. Considering the rate we booked it for I was very pleased. Neat, clean with everything we needed. The only complaint we had was the concierge. It was my birthday and my husband asked if the concierge could arrange a flower delivery to our room in the morning. He replied that it was not possible as there were no florists nearby. He can't call interflora? It was a small thing but his job is to help guests and this is a simple request. The lounge downstairs has a very nice cocktail list and it was a great place to stop for a drink before we went to bed. I would stay there again, but don't ask for anything extra. Its a bit too much, apparently.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, with pleasant service.”
Reviews.Author: VacationBears
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze, and they found us a room before the actual check-in time. I suppose this is partly one of the benefit of off-peak season holidaying too. The room was neat clean and big enough for the little one to explore a little, with sufficient space for the luggage and enough table top space (for notebook, food and travel brochures). The two double beds with eight pillows is great fun for the small boy. The location was not perfect but close enough to Darling Harbour, Town Hall and Chinatown. There was an IMAX theatre nearby, with a nice Ice Cream parlour and Burger Grill. The concierge as expected was helpful and friendly. We did not use any of the amenities since most of our time was spend exploring Sydney but I think there isn't a pool. Anyway, it was too cold for a swim. Expected to pay for internet, so we bought a mobile data package from the telcom instead. Overall, value for money and decent accommodation for a vacationing family.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: AjmMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Excellant location Room comfortable and clean Overall hotel is mid range level

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will stay again !!”
Reviews.Author: Marsbar66
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a Harbour view Orchid club room and can highly recommend it. The room was spacious and clean , the bed was comfortable and the view over Darling Harbour was great. The Orchid club was a pleasant bonus with evening drinks and canapes and a delicious continental breakfast. All the staff from reception to the cleaning crew were pleasant and helpful. The hotel is in easy walking distance of the Darling Harbour restaurants and China Town. We found this hotel to be much better than others we have stayed at in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, huge breakfast buffet, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: secluded
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was one of the only ones in Sydney our travel agent could find that would give us a rate that included breakfast. The breakfast buffet turned out to be massive, and a great deal: steam table with hot food, many cold cereals, including muesli, choice of nuts, fresh fruit, breads, cold meats, hot drinks and juices, etc. Otherwise, the hotel was a solid mid-range place to stay. Not very exciting, but very comfortable, good-sized room and bathroom. About that view we'd read about on Tripadvisor: yes, we did ask for the waterfront view, and since we were upgraded to the top floor by the friendly staff at check-in, we really didn't mind the highway running in front of the water. No noise from the traffic. Location was excellent for easily getting to all the Sydney sights, and was right next to Chinatown where we had outstanding, reasonably priced Thai food.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: sharen6133
Reviews.Content: Though we have not been there, we did book ParkRoyal last week for 4th till 8th Jul. (4nights stay) We prepaid full payment and requested for twin room by email. They didn't answer our requests so we asked for Hotelclub help to make twin room request. Though they did have twin room avaliable on 7/4-5 & 7/7 (only 7/6 is not avaible), they refused to provide us twin room and ask us to pay rollaway extracharge AU65/day. We never met such a 4 star hotel to provide differential service to customers.

Reviews.Title: “OK only, much better choices”
Reviews.Author: DadTravelOrganiser
Reviews.Content: This is an average business hotel. It is in a good location for Darling Harbour, and is a short walk up to the main shopping area of the CBD. There is nothing to rave about though. The main problem is its design - all rooms open onto a big atrium that just conducts noise, and this makes the place noisy. There are many better choices nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Hampton_Lovetotravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay is not worth the money if staff is not friendly. I will call ParkRoyal staff bad or even nasty. Can't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Midrange Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rob091
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk to Darling Harbour and to the CBD. The rooms are comfortable and reasonably spacious. Hotel service and reception was friendly and welcoming. The hotel is a little tired but nothing to worry about. Overall this hotel is typical of mid range business hotels in Sydney and a good choice as long as you get a reasonable rate. The Internet charge was ridiculously high and we were both overcharged for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not worth it”
Reviews.Author: marydougan
Reviews.Content: Very unhelpful on check-in; no Concierge offered to take luggage to our rooms - we had booked and were travelling with an elderly parent. Rooms did not have complimentary water; bed was awful - it needed replacing as we sunk into the mattress. Great location for Darling Harbour although a walk uphill with an elderly parent; very close to China Town and shopping but also uphill. My advice - book into somewhere on the Rocks and give this one a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxsterPerth
Reviews.Content: This place is perfectly located for Darling Harbour, the CBD and Chinatown. I would recommend this hotel for business travellers or anyone on a short stay in Sydney. A pool would be nice but there's usually so much to do in Sydney that you can live without it! The staff were friendly and professional although we rarely needed their assistance. The downstairs bar is ok for a casual drink although the lounge chairs could do with a bit of a clean. The upstairs restaurant was actually quite good. I had the wagyu beef there and it was cooked to perfection. There are heaps of eating places very close to the hotel. I would recommend the nearby Kaz Cafe for brekky and Darling Harbour or Chinatown for lunch or dinner. The only really negative thing I can say about the hotel is the pillows are bloody awful but nothing a call to Housekeeping couldn't fix.

Reviews.Title: “VERY IMPRESSED with PARKROYAL - an ideal venue for your Sydney stay.”
Reviews.Author: HolidayMum02
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults 2 small children) stayed at PARKROYAL Darling Harbour over the Easter/Anzac weekend, and were very impressed with the venue. Great value for money, wonderful friendly service, and a central location. On arrival into the grand entrance we were met with valet parking, a concierge to take our bags to our room, and quick and easy check-in. We booked a Family Package which was excellent value, including the best brekky spread in the restaurant every morning. We were also given a free newspaper and bottled water every day. Our room was lovely and spacious with a nice big bathroom (with bath), and serviced daily. We had only requested a City View but were given a Darling Harbour view. We were on the 4th floor, no noise, except for spectacular viewing of the Fireworks on Darling Harbour!. It is only 2 blocks down from George St, with easy walking distance to everything. We dined in the Restaurant one night (free for children), and also ordered room service - both lovely meals. THANKYOU Parkroyal, I will be telling my friends about you!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: jojo90Perth
Reviews.Content: I think satisfaction depends on the room rate paid. We booked direct with the hotel using the advance purchase rate (as we are a family of 2 adults and 2 young children we can't easily use the cheaper online options as we 'exceed maximum occupancy'). The rate for standard room (2 double beds) with a city view was $350/night! I know it is a risk you take with advance purchase rates but when the hotel then changed hands we could have got a better room with breakfast included for the same rate. We were never told before or after the event that the hotel's name had changed. I found this out myself through Tripadvisor which I felt was quite poor customer service. The staff were helpful and the room was adequate but somewhat old and tired. It certainly didn't reflect the 4 star rating and room cost. We are in a hotel of similar rating and cost in Los Angeles which is much nicer and we have a family suite for the same price! The location was disappointing as I naively thought the hotel would actually be on the harbour but although it is only a five minute walk the location itself is not at all scenic surrounded by roads and an underpass. The $99 charge for breakfast was a bit steep considering my youngest child only ate an apple! In short it was OK but I wouldn't come here again at the rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: jayrt619
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Parkroyal Darling Harbour and had an overall positive experience. The location of the hotel was the best thing about it. We were steps away from Darling Harbour and a short walk or drive away from anywhere else worth seeing in Sydney CBD. The first thing that I noticed once I stepped inside was the clean and fresh smell. I don't know what sort of fragrance the hotel used but the inside smelled really good. The service from the staff was great and everyone was very helpful especially the concierges. The breakfast buffet was expansive and was always a great start to our day. I only didn't like two things. There wasn't a pool and jacuzzi and I didn't like the view of the freeway onramps from our hotel room on the 3rd floor. Not much anyone can do about that at this point. Overall, we had a great experience in the hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and accomodating at all stages!”
Reviews.Author: __hellyes
Reviews.Content: Very smooth process throughout our overnight stay at the Parkroyal. Booked through Wotif for an amazing $149 special with a bottle of wine and late checkout. We arrived at midday and were informed our designated room wasn't ready but they found another room (which we believe was an upgrade as the bed was a king, not queen) immediately. We were given our wine and our late checkout was re-confirmed, lovely desk staff. Later when we called down for ice, it was delivered in mere minutes. Room was very clean and spacious, with the bathroom large than most hotels with a seperate bath and shower and a spacious vanity area. The bed was also lovely and comfortable. Only mild complaint was you could hear some traffic noise as we were on the first floor but it wasn't overly noticeable and not the hotels fault. The location is also fantastic, in a culdesac so the outside of the hotel isn't busy or full of pedestrians, and just 2 blocks down from Town Hall station and a brief walk from Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of accumulated annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Sasha199
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a year ago when it was a Crown Plaza, and it was just OK. If anything it has gone downhill since then. The first annoyance was the impenetrable pricing system. I was travelling to a conference with several colleagues. Despite everybody asking for the 'corporate rate' and all booking at around the same time, we were each paying vastly different amounts. As many of us were paying our own way, the people who paid the most felt very ripped off. As we checked in at the same time, the differential was very obvious and the receptionist was quite rude when the issue was raised: "this is why we don't like guests to check in at the same time". The room was fine, and very clean, but all the pillows provided were like cement. The business centre, for what is clearly a business hotel is a joke. Not enough computers, and no working printer! How hard it is to get a printer fixed? On check out I had an extra $45 on my bill for valet parking. When I disputed this it was quickly removed,but with a surly glance from the clerk. These spurious charges on hotel bills indicate to me either a slap dash approach to allocating costs to guests (was this someone else's charge?), or an attempt to pad a bill hoping corporate clients dont notice. The location is very drab. On a map it looks like it is on the charming Darling Harbour but it is actually in the middle of a spaghetti junction of depressing freeways and busy roads. Overall, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location for darling harbor !”
Reviews.Author: Jogospel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10am tired but the check in was very swift and very efficient. We were told our room wasn't ready but took my mobile no to be contacted when ready, we had no problem with that as check in isn't till 2pm so we went to get a coffee and returned an hour later to be given our keys to the room and an upgrade to harbor view instead of city which we were made up with! The rooms were very clean lovely bathroom. The breakfast was fantastic something for everyone!!!! The location is fab, 2 mins walk to darling harbor, go out of hotel to the right through an alley then left over the walkway and your there! We would definitely return to this hotel the staff we came across were faultless!

Reviews.Title: “BAD CHECK IN EXPERINCE”
Reviews.Author: 255100Minnie
Reviews.Content: Booked , a nite stay for parents as a gift for my parents , rang staff to inform them of this was told this would not be an issue.But , when my parents arrived they were confronted with probelms & were made to feel very uncomfortable a problem also arose concerning parking. By the time they finally checked in the were both quiet shaken, I , cannot believe i paid for my parents to go through this- it was far from a smooth check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bs_senno
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at Parkroyal for a few nights while visiting Sydney for a friends wedding. We found the staff very friendly. We found the rooms quite comfortable but didn't spend to much time inside as we were out all day and also went out at night. I have to recommend the Sydney Showboat. It is a paddle steamer which you get a three course meal with and a show. We didn't eat the Parkroyal, we walked over to the Wharf and ate at one of many little resturants. The Parkroyal is in such a great location with everything in walking distance and if your legs get tired the monorail is at the wharf which takes you to the museums, paddys market, the mall and a short walk to the opera house. We would stay there again. The only dissapointment was the parking fee. As we had to fly to sydney and then hire a car we were shocked to find out how expensive the parking was, it just made everything a bit more expensive than we would have liked. But other than that we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Archer_011
Reviews.Content: Likes: Comfortable bed, Great breakfast (included in rate), lots of choice and coffee made freshly, good size gym area and equipment, shower had good water flow and was hot. Close to Darling Harbour, Market and China Town. Dislikes : shower in bath, with taps down low, room a bit dated, hard to understand reception person on check-in. Booked room as a secret hotel at lastminute.com.au, would stay again if booked for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Marie65_10
Reviews.Content: We booked online for Jan 20th for a great rate for two nights before sailing. Close to Darling Harbour. Walking to Markets, Chinatown and harbour. Super stay, very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenTAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only one night. Got a great rate on lastminute.com which included dinner and breakfast. Both meals were excellent. On check in the very friendly girl at reception asked if we were in the city for any particular reason. We said we were staying for our anniversary. About one hour later we received a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine and a card to wish us a happy anniversary. What a lovely surprise - it's the little things like that that make a big difference. Room was good. Great blockout curtains. Bathroom big and everything we needed. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short citybreak”
Reviews.Author: veronim
Reviews.Content: Went here with my daughter, got a great last min secret deal. Not right ion darling harbor, but only a short walk. Great room , helpful concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel with annoying staff”
Reviews.Author: agentblond11
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for 4 nights over the Australia day public holiday so we could see the fireworks. On check in the staff treated us with the attitude of 'why are you here?'. The lifts are old and you can get caught in the doors as the sensors dont work. The rooms are old and dated I would have said this hotel was 3 star if that. We had club room access which is also dated but has nice staff. We too were interrupted numerous times in the afternoons to have someone check the minibar, then clean the room, then turn down the bed that was just made - why cant' this all be done at once?

Reviews.Title: “Great for Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Gwyndolen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights as part of a tour of Australia. The hotel was in a great location for the nightlife and restaurants around Darling Harbour and Chinatown. The room was clean but we only had a queen size double bed which was not very comfortable. Check-in staff were polite and the concierge service was very good and provided maps. We did not eat in the hotel as there were plenty of good restaurants nearby and a convenience store that was great for breakfast goodies. The best find of our holiday was a great Thai restaurant called Home just around the corner in Sussex Street. It was always busy, the food was great and very reasonably priced, especially for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family night away.”
Reviews.Author: Batts777
Reviews.Content: My husband and my children (6 years and 4 years) stayed at the Parkroyal Darling Harbour for one night in January. We were able to book the room thru lastminute.com.au and got a pretty good deal using their Family Package. The room had two double beds which was fine by us and was just a standard room. It was very clean and the linen was lovely. It was in a great location (a cross the road from Darling Harbour) and the breakfast the next morning was wonderful. The kids did not know where to start. Some of the hotel is looking a little old but it is very clean and it was fantastic for a family night away.

Reviews.Title: “Looking a bit dated but ok”
Reviews.Author: emdeme
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on return from overseas trip so really just wanted a place to recover from our flight, got a great deal on a Secret hotel with Lastminute -to work out which hotel it is you just need to do a Google search using some of the descriptive words - this one was a Cityscape room in Darling Harbour and it was pretty easy to work out which hotel it was! Helpful check in staff let us into our room early so we could get some sleep, great bed! Room itself is looking a bit dated and tatty, but ok. Big bathroom, best feature of hotel is the location - not really in Darling Harbour but not far from it, on the city side, lots of restaurants nearby, close to the Spanish area so great food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulineNorris
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean & staff very friendly & helpful, especially valet men. Have to pay for the carpark which was very expensive. A cheaper & public carpark is 2 minutes down the road if you can be bothered. The hotel offered free wifi which was brilliant when travelling. The room was VERY small (us & 2 kids) and hot - air conditioning was rubbish. Walk to Darling Harbour itself was across 3 sets of pedestrian crossings which took ages to change so added loads of time onto walk. Was a nice hotel but honestly think you could find nicer in the area

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service with friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: AustravellerQld
Reviews.Content: I have had a great experience staying at the Park Royal hotel. Hotel facilities itself is not of modern standard, eg. old minibar fridge that struggle to work but hotel facilities offer family frienldy admostsphere and staffs are friendly and helpful, especially bell caption, front desk staff. Staffs always give great service with a smile and treat you with respect. I would come back to this hotel anytime and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for family”
Reviews.Author: Mpeg36
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic deal on expedia.com for two night stay including breakfast. The room was lovely with a view over Darling Harbour. The breakfast was fantastic - one of the best we have had in a hotel in Australia. The location was convenient as it was an easy walk to Chinatown, the city or Darling Harbour. Highly recommend. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Sydney? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: snowyowl111
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the ParkRoyal on the 28th December 2010 for our honeymoon that ended on the 11th Jan 2011. When we booked the hotel we specifically requested a honeymoon suite. This request was ignored and we were sandwiched in between 2 family rooms. Cue crying babies keeping us awake for the next 14 days. The room itself was a city view, which personally I think is an ambitious name for a room that looks out onto an apartment block but never mind. The bathroom was clean and modern with a sort of half bath thing and a walk in shower. It was nice. The main room let the place down a bit though with mismatched furniture and large chips taken out of the bedside tables. This had been 'repaired' with what looked like nail varnish, although maybe it was what passed for wood stain. It certainly didn't match the original colour though. The first day we were there we stayed out of the hotel to about 4 in the afternoon. We returned to the hotel to find our room still hadn't been made up. We were then interrupted by no less than 3 (!!) different members of staff. 1 to make the room up, 1 to check the mini bar and 1 to empty the bins. Forgive me if I'm wrong but couldn't 1 member of staff manage that? The next day we had a knock on the door at 0800 by the maid. This pattern continued for our entire stay. What ever time we went out our room was not made up when we returned apart from one day when we didn't get back til gone 8 in the evening. Some days they didn't even change the sheets. I know this as one day my foot bled (burst blister) and the mark was still there 2 days later. The lack of balcony was also disappointing, it would have been nice to be able to step outside on the days we didn't really want to go anywhere but this wasn't really a problem. The concierge was about as much use as a chocolate teapot. We had tickets to see the test match and when we asked him the best way to get to the SCG he told us to take a taxi for about $20. A further conversation with the South African doorman revealed that there was a bus up the street we could catch for $2. The only other time we needed the concierge was when the group in the family room next door to us decided to have a party at 0300. They promised to do something about it however it was left to another guest to complain to the people making the noise that they had a baby. They turned the music down eventually but continued to make a racket until gone 0500. The hotel did nothing but provide us with earplugs. They didn't even pass the message on to the day staff, we had to tell them. When we told the manager her exact words were 'what do you expect us to do about it?' Seriously. Then there was the wonderful time the bell-boy decided to deliver someone else's bags to our room. On discovery that there was someone there she looked confused then told us we were in the wrong room! Interesting. On the positive side the TV offered a wide range of channels, although it was a good thing we like sport as this was on just about all of them! If you wanted to stay in your room and watch sport all day you could, although you would have to put up with phone calls from the main desk asking you when you want the room made up (it's telling that the signs for your door don't say Do Not Disturb. They say Privacy Please which the staff seem to take as a sign to disturb as much as possible). You could start the day watching english football, carry on to the NHL then go into the test match and finish the evening with the Big Bash! Also the situation of the hotel is brilliant. Darling harbour is by far the best of the 2 and is within easy access to just about everywhere. The hotel bar is also great. The food is lovely and the staff are friendly even when you ask them to put the cricket on when they're losing. But you don't have to stay at the hotel to use the bar. In summary I have no idea how they managed to get a 4* rating, or as some websites put it 4.5* I have stayed in better 2* hotels.

Reviews.Title: “New brand same tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonSussex
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel has re-branded to the Park Royal there is very little evidence of renovation or redecoration since our visit last year, however the staff are much more customer friendly and helpful than before. The first room we were allocated on floor 10 was damp, musty and scruffy (with dead insects left on the wardrobe door and mouldy fridge), recepetion soon resolved this issue and we were given a room on the 9th floor which was larger and brighter with a large bathroom. Rooms also have flat screen TV's but the furniture is due for a change, however the bed was very comfy and we slept well in this hotel. Location is great for Darling Harbour and The Rocks and overall the hotel was very quiet if in need of a bit of TLC. Once again no free wi-fi access anywhere in the hotel (what is wrong with Australian hotels???).

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Darling Harbor, now Park Royal”
Reviews.Author: janetdib
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 lovely days in Sydney. We got a great deal on Last minute secret hotel deal, however when I rang the hotel the night before to confirm my booking their was an issue with the dates....I rang Last minute who were onto it straight away. Much to our amazement when we arrived the next day they had given us a huge suite with a loungeroom, bedroom with King size bed and a huge bathroom, with a wonderful view of Darling Harbor for our troubles....Now that was a lovely surprise....Checkin was a breeze and the staff at the desk and concierge were always helpful and smiling. The hotel was 5 mins walk across the bridge to the heart of Darling Harbor, 10 mins walk into the city centre and 5 mins walk to China town. Very central and a great location. Only negative if I have to mention one is some of the furniture could do with an update. Other than that, we would be very happy to recommend this hotel and will definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, with one niggling problem.”
Reviews.Author: kelvincheong
Reviews.Content: What can I say. One of the best Australian hotels we've stayed at. The staff were courteous and professional (despite the busy week), the room was modern, clean and quiet. Location is great, easy walkable distance to Darling Harbour, Chinatown, Westfield and QBD. Everything that a couple can ask for. The only thing that bothered me was the air-conditioning which made rattling noises (I'm a light sleeper, so that woke me up until I adjusted it to a medium setting from low). Overall, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend getway”
Reviews.Author: BeautyandBeast6277
Reviews.Content: I had purchased tickets to see Bon Jovi, so my husband and i decided to go away for our 10 year wedding anniversary and make a weekend out of it. We found the accommodation through Last Minute.com mystery deal at a great price. The room was on level 1 and was a king size room. It was wonderfully spacious, clean and the bed was very comfortable. It had alot of wonderful amenities and the service at the desk was fantastic. The only negative comment i would make is that its now called the Park Royal Darling Harbour and it was confusing to find as there was no sign to say formerly Crowne Plaza Darling Harbour. Not sure if that was an error from Last Minute.com. Definitely would use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Now the Park Royal Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Royal Darling Harbour for 3 nights. The hotel is reasonably located on the fringe of Chinatown, between the City and Darling Harbour. You can walk to Town Hall Station in about 5 or 6 minutes. The hotel is getting on in years, but has been renovated to a reasonable standard. Check in was fast and friendly and we were in the room very quickly. The room itself is a reasonable size and standard, with two double beds, modern TV and a decent bathroom. A couple of issues with the Parkroyal - firstly, 'extras' such as internet ($30/day), breakfast ($35/head) and parking ($42/day) were grossly overpriced. Factor these into your room cost when you make a booking. Secondly, on two separate occassions hotel staff burst into our room without knocking, despite a 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door. This has never happened to me in a hotel before and was a bit unsettling! The first time we had a bizzare conversation with a non-English speaking maid who seemed to be inviting us to order from the room service menu (??!?). The second time two workmen wanted to check smoke alarms. A knock would have been nice!! Overall though, this is a fair hotel which seems to be quite heavily discounted online. If you can get it for a good price it is a workable option for your Sydney stay.

Reviews.Title: “Parkroyal At Darling Harbour - no longer the crowne”
Reviews.Author: whitepointer
Reviews.Content: I am dissapointer in the change to parkroyal as i no loger earn Qantas Frequent Flyer points. Subsequently i wont stay there again there are other hotels that earn QFF points. shame for them really coz i was sraying there every two weeks. The business centre computer are dreadfully slow - over the 4 days i stayed every computer was the same (ie slow internet) go to the convenience store nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: PARKROYAL Darling Harbour Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 150 Day St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
